page.title: 06DEIGHTON CHANGING TIMES
page.content: Deighton has contracted over the last 50 years, and lost its school,village inn and parish council.Mrs.Kirby snr. was a pupil at the school,which closed in 1930.The teacher lived in the village.There is a stained glass window in the church commemorating the teacher's 45 years at the school.The house at the Southern end of the terraced row was formerly the Three Horseshoes Inn, but this closed in the early 1950's.Behind the row of terraced houses is a grassed area surrounded by a moat about 10 feet deep.It is thought to have been the site of an ancient manor dating back to King Stephen and also used as a stockade to protect cattle from marauding Scots.The old brick making site on the Appleton road known as the Tileshed was latterly used for animals until it collapsed in 1984. .
